info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:28PM MDT until July 22 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO...NORTHERN WALLACE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL KANSAS AND SOUTH CENTRAL SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 327 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles north of Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 30 mph. An additional storm was located 9 miles north of Weskan moving south. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sharon Springs and Wallace. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
